article.headline: LSU 84, Tennessee 67
article.story: BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) -- LSU coach John Brady's decision to put guard Darrel Mitchell into the starting lineup looks like a good one. Mitchell scored a career-high 22 points and had eight assists in his second game as a starter, leading the Tigers to their third straight victory, a 84-67 win over Tennessee on Wednesday. "Darrel really sparks our team," Brady said. "He's just a good solid player who doesn't mind at all whether he comes off the bench or starts." The Tigers (15-4, 5-3 Southeastern Conference) ended a four-game losing streak to the Volunteers (11-7, 3-5) in Baton Rouge. Mitchell was 8-of-11 from the field, including 6-of-9 from 3-point range. Antonio Hudson, whom Mitchell replaced as a starter, scored 17 points off of the bench, hitting 4-of-5 from 3-point range. LSU shot 29-of-48, or 60.4 percent, from the field and hit 10-of-18 3-pointers. "I can't tell you what it means to make a few shots from the corner, and how it can change the complexion of a game," Brady said. "We made a lot of good, timely shots tonight." Jaime Lloreda had 18 points and 12 rebounds, and Brandon Bass and Tack Minor each had 10 points for LSU. Lloreda, who leads the SEC in rebounding at 11.7 per game, left the game with 14:26 remaining after getting his fourth personal foul. "LSU's strength is on the inside, there's no doubt, and we gave up a lot of points inside," Tennessee coach Buzz Peterson said. Scooter McFagdon led the Volunteers with 21 points. Jemere Hendrix and Brandon Crump added 12 each. Jemere Hendrix's jumper at the midway point of the first half pulled the Volunteers into a 15-15 tie, but LSU answered with a 10-2 run, including 3-pointers by Hudson and Mitchell, and the Tigers led 38-34 at the half. Tennessee was within 41-39 two minutes into the second half, but an 11-4 run by the Tigers extended LSU's lead to double figures for the first time at 60-49. <
